reviewText: I really liked this game, it has more pathways (admittedly to similar results) than expected, and I found the characters' reactions refreshing and...as realistic as can be expected from a story about an 11 year old detective. Plus, it's very easy to get back into favor with them if you make a mistake with one of the ones you like.\nIt is disappointing that the narration assumes your character is inherantly moral at times, sometimes I want to play as evil! It does warrent a few replays because of the different pathways. Overall, it's cute, the characters don't make me feel murderous and the mysteries are fun.
voteText: 12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This developer, Choice of Games, consistently make games that while they have a strong variety of choices to make in the gameplay, they're always pretty short in game length (Playing through it took about 75 minutes for me), and simply don't give you motivation to replay them, this game included. I don't consider this game to be worth the money spent when some of their other games give you about as much satisfaction while being free. The romance" and daing mentioned in the description
date: ended up being a few paragraphs at the end of the game before it abruptly ends at a cliffhanger
recommended: and I just sat there wondering where the rest of my game was. It felt like the developers just ran out of ideas and decided to just end the story there. If there were more content added and the game didnt just end in the middle of the dance
hoursPlayed: I might change my mind about this game."

reviewText:
This is a good CYOA to start with. But there are few things I am not happy with. Firstly the length is quite short in my opinion and the idea is vaguely similar to Psy High, another product of COG, altough the setting is quite different. Loved the attempt of solving myteries but I could not feel any real impact of the investigations. The consequences felt as very minor.

The game takes one case to another quite abruptly and doesnt give time to adjust ourselves. It could have been expanded between cases for more character development and approach to cases more naturally.It is like one minute you reading conclusion to one case then boom next chapter you chatting with someone else then comes next case. Maybe thats how mystery novels are written but I am not comfortable with it.

Plus sides are the writing were short and good. Doesn't lose me half way through the page. A good one but with some minor flaws. Get it if you want to be school detective. But there are better COG products with better value for money.

7/10 In game and review, I did not lie
but my pants been on fire since I was five.
Thank you for making me Honest Abe for a while.

date: they are actual things kids most likely will say. I really enjoyed this choose your own adventure game and will urge anyone who is into these types of games to give it a try."

reviewText:
pretty simple, as far as games go. once you've solved the mysteries, they seem to stay the same, but the characters were cute and endearing enough for me to be really interested - probably enough to collect all of the achievements.

ended up dating evan at the end my first runthrough, which was adorable. i liked his character quite a bit, and hey, why not. he's an adorable kiddo who likes makeovers and is good at 'em, totally works with the younger version of me in-game. i know that shanti(? that was her name? sorry, bad with names) is another love option, and so is aj, but is everyone else? i'd assume so, maybe (other than the adults) - which might've explained why the 'romance' was limited to a few paragraphs at the end instead of being through the whole game.

the cases themselves were cute and charming enough, though a bit easy - i can imagine this one is for kids though so, y'know, they're supposed to be. still worth my time, though. i'd have liked a bit more interactivity, maybe? an option to actually - for example - type in the passcode with the cipher during the case involving the phone. that's a minor detail, though.

i'm not judging this too harshly, but i'd love to see a sequel that actually picks up from the dance onwards, since it seems like there's more material to run on, and hey, there's a bit of potential.

pros:
- characters are cute
- mysteries are kinda interesting
- story is sweet and charming like a kid's book (it gave me vibes of books i used to read in the library when i was in elementary school, hahaha)
- overall very optimistic and bright-spirited which is refreshing amongst the more dramatic games
- a lot of sequel hooks, provided the writer makes a sequel
- can play as gay, straight, and even be agender (which, yeah, is a typical thing amongst COG games, but it's still nice to note especially in a game targeted to younger audiences)

cons:
- kinda short
- once you've seen the mysteries, you know the solutions
- romance is a bit limited but i wouldn't expect that much considering it seems to be intended for kids
- might not be for everyone
- some of the choices you'd think would make a huge difference (retrieving brown ugly straight away) don't really

i'll give it a 7/10. i'd say at least give the demo a shot and if ya like what ya see there, you'll probably enjoy it. but i'd appreciate a sequel just to go further in-depth. there's a lot of potential for this to be a mini-series released every so often with more school related cases and character development. if i were the writer, i wouldn't let that potential slip by.
voteText: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Sixth Grade Detective is a pretty cute game about 11-12 years old detective in school setting. You will be study (a little), have fun with friends and classmates (more often) and solve mysteries (a lot). The world and people around you are easygoing, characters are pretty realistic and fun and even if you’ll make some mistake, you always can fix it and that encourage you to actually playing the way you like it, not just “make everything perfect and everyone happy” way. Mysteries are not that difficult, you can easy solve it, if you’re fan of children’s or adult detective books and quest’s games (most certainly even without these traits), still they’re nice and interesting and have a spirit of all these detective books.
And, yes, my favorite game’s part, besides solving mysteries, is characters. There’re really quite diverse cast: rebel kid, cute girl, nerd girl, smart boy and creative boy – each with their own personality and interests. Chatting and spending time with them are really fun, it’s like you back in your childhood, but without bullies, bad teachers and homework! And if you nice enough, you’ll see pretty cute teen romance. And have a date. And a dance.
Still you should know that the game is a short one (you can finish it in two hours) and there not so much replayability as you might hope for. For me it’s not a big deal – the atmosphere and the story are good and that’s what I looking for.
So, yeah, I highly recommend game for fans of children’s detective books\movies\comics\etc. It’s really nice and you’ll have a good time.

reviewText: Honesly this game isn't worth the $4. I played it and this doesn't give the best story line. It's just a story that you read and choose different answers to come with a different outcome. So I suppose if you have nothing to do and you are really bored you can play this in one sitting. Otherwise, I would choose a different game. Try the game Who's Your Daddy?" or "The Stanley Parable". Now those are games worth the money."

reviewText: One of the most expansive and immersive RPGs of this era. The author perfectly crafted a deep web of intrigue and conspiracy that will surely take scholars decades to untangle and solve. By the end of my two hour playthrough, I was imbued with wisdom that would otherwise have taken several lifetimes to amass without the ability to live and learn vicariously through the characters in this work. Truly magnificent.

reviewText: I played the first chapter of this game for free and I had to buy the whole thing - it is engaging, well written and enjoyable. With enough achievements to spur you on to collect them all and several different characters to investigate, it is good fun. My only criticism is that no matter how you play the game, it doesn't change the plot all that much, so the level of replayability isn't great. I'd say it is worth the cost.

I love this game and this is a spoiler if you don't want to read it but I was left off a clifhanger in the end. I got so crazy after that clifhanger came about in the end where the dance is. I expected that the dance story would be longer because not all of the clues were answered. For one I got though my first playthough with 1 lie. 1 LIE! But thats not the fact. I get about the ending but would like another part to this story of the dance at least. I mean the crown goes missing and all I do is roll up my sleeves. Sounds like I'm going to find the person but ends right there. Overall the game was made to be great. I love it and others would love it too. Keep up the good work and I would love the cliffhanger wouldn't leave me off of one. I mean someone stole the crown! Enough ranting over how it is. I love the game and wish to play the dance a little longer. Maybe I could in another run but not today. Good game and would recommend it to others.

This game only took an hour and a half to play through, but that was fair enough for what it cost - it was cheaper than going to a movie and I think I'd say I enjoyed it more than most movies.  Even though the graphics are functional at best, being mainly text, I felt really involved in the game - it was well paced and well written.  Although it gives you the choice to play as a boy or a girl, there are a few points in which you can tell it's written with a girl character in mind (I don't think any boy's Dad calls him 'sweetie'), but for the most part I think all the choices of ways to play allow for plenty of replay value.  The main improvement I'd like to see is a choice of a different colour scheme - staring at black text on a white screen for over an hour was quite tiring on my eyes!

I can't say it was a masterpiece or that it was my favorite CoG game ever... but I really enjoyed it. The characters were written nicely, the story was fun. It was a little to short for my taste and lacked development in a few story aspects. But it was still a pleasant experience.\n\nWould very much like to see something like Part 2 and maybe 3 for MC high school, colledge or adult life. Or even in the same setting. Just anything that would make this story longer.
Made my kid drink beer, steal a bike, and wear a flaming pink poet's shirt. Where else would I be able to do this ♥♥♥♥? Pretty fun.
Only played this game through once, but it was a great once. Really enjoyed it, had a blast. just wish it was longer and deeper. Totally recommended!! Great game.

I played the first chapter of this game for free and I had to buy the whole thing - it is engaging, well written and enjoyable. With enough achievements to spur you on to collect them all and several different characters to investigate, it is good fun. My only criticism is that no matter how you play the game, it doesn't change the plot all that much, so the level of replayability isn't great. I'd say it is worth the cost.

I really liked the writing style, which wasn't overly adorned and made for smooth reading. The characters are interesting and you grow to like some of them as you progress in the story. The mysteries are my favorite part! All in all, I'd definitely reccomend it.
